title: minor fixes including variable name change and expanded rdoc
has_many through obeys order on through association
body: fixes #10016

title: Improve AdapterNotSpecified error message
body: Add the name of the database to the AdapterNotSpecified error message in resolve_hash_connection.  If you're connecting to multiple databases, it can be seriously crazy-making to not know which one the error is referring to.  This will help.

title: Add additional assertion match for flash notice in scaffold controller
body: What do you think?

title: fix warnings in railties test
body: fix warning with enclosing in ()

title: add require to suppress warning; remove variable
body:
1. add require to expose `to_d` method and suppress warning
2. drop unnecessary variable assignment

Not so sure about 1. but wanted to propose the change

title: Fixed Typo
Fix some railties test warnings
body:
Fix some railties test warnings
1. Initialize variable
2. Encapsulate variable in ()

title: Removed unused comma after loop variable
body: Removed unused comma after loop variable in the test case.

title: Remove comments about removing LegacyKeyGenerator in 4.1
body:
We have a deprecation warning in place if you set only `secret_token`, so that should alleviate any concerns we have about security here. 

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/application.rb#L138-L147

People will be nagged into setting `secret_key_base`. Leaving `secret_token` set causes no harm, and its presence allows for a smooth transition from Rails 3.x to 4.x. 

I propose that we leave `LegacyKeyGenerator` around beyond version 4.0.x. 

I suspect that latecomers will attempt to upgrade from 3.x to whatever the most recent 4.x version happens to be. If we remove `LegacyKeyGenerator`, then people attempting to upgrade from 3.x to >= 4.1 won't be able to preserve their existing signed cookies and cookie-based sessions.

title: update the guides to reflect the new `rails test` command
body:
There were a few sections in the guides that still mentioned the rake tasks to run the tests. I updated them to reference the new `rails test` command and added some links to the testing guide.

Also while I was at it I reconditioned the references section in the testing guide.

title: fix regression in Mapper when `format:` was used in a `scope`.
body:
Closes #10071

`#normalize_path!` depends on the options so we need to call `#normalize_options!` first to make sure everything is set correctly.

I did not add a CHANGELOG entry as it fixes a regression only present in master. Let me know if I should put one in anyways.

title: Avoid running bundler on tests that don't need it
body:
#### Railties test timings on Intel(R) Core(TM) i3 CPU 550  @ 3.20GHz

Before: 18m19.854s
After: 8m57.653s

title: Added test for Array#to_formatted_s
body:
Behavior different from the contents currently written to rdoc is carried out. 

> Blog.all.map(&:title) #=> ["First Post", "Second Post", "Third post"]
>
> `to_formatted_s` shows us:
>
>   Blog.all.to_formatted_s # => "First PostSecond PostThird Post"

But, wrote test code is fails.

>  1) Failure:
> ArrayExtToFormattedS#test_to_formatted_default [/Users/eiel/src/rails/activesupp
> ort/test/core_ext/array_ext_test.rb:41]:
> --- expected
> +++ actual
> @@ -1 +1 @@
> -"First ObjectSecond ObjectThird Object"
> +"[#<#<Class:0xXXXXXX>:0xXXXXXX>, #<#<Class:0xXXXXXX>:0xXXXXXX>, #<#<Class:0xXXXXXX>:0xXXXXXX>]"

As the simplistic solution thought of: 
```diff
diff --git a/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb b/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb
index 430a35f..500cb73 100644
--- a/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb
+++ b/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/array/conversions.rb
@@ -108,7 +108,7 @@ class Array
         collect { |element| element.id }.join(',')
       end
     else
-      to_default_s
+      collect { |element| element.to_s }.join
     end
   end
   alias_method :to_default_s, :to_s
```

Influence seems to be great to others. 
First of all, please let me know what kind of behavior is right.

title: Fix a SystemStackError that occurs when using time zone aware attributes...
body: This fixes issue #10066

title: Add block support for the mail_to helper
body:
This one has caught me out a couple of times recently, since I use the block version of the `link_to` helper quite frequently. This pull request adds block support to the `mail_to` helper so that it works similarly to the `link_to` helper.

A similar update should probably also be made to the actionview-encoded_mail_to gem. I'm happy to submit another pull request to https://github.com/reed/actionview-encoded_mail_to for that change.

title: Fix grammatical error on JS helper warning message
body: Fix a grammatical error on the JavaScript helper warning message. The verb in this sentence should be followed by a gerund instead of an infinitive.

title: Per #9999 revert blank? to empty?
body:
Change blank? in column.rb to empty?

This is both faster and more correct, added tests to make sure this is not reverted again.

title: Rename DummyKeyGenerator -> LegacyKeyGenerator
body: I don't think "dummy" isn't a very descriptive name. I've settled on "legacy" to refer to signed stuff generated by Rails 3.x in the work I did on #9740 and #9909 . I'm open to other names, but I'd like to move away from "dummy".

title: Cookies refactoring
body:
Should be applied after #10059. 

This is a small refactoring to standardize the language we use when talking about cookies. We use `name` and `key` now. @jeremy suggested `name` would be more appropriate, and I agree if for no other reason that we're using the word `key` a lot when talking about the `key_generator`. 

This also snips :scissors: a couple blank lines below `private` to match current Rails style.

title: Fix permanent cookie jar accessor typo
body: Fixes a small typo that broke `PermanentCookieJar#[]`

title: Avoid calling define_method in CollectionProxy#scope
body: Calling define_method busts the method cache, which has a major performance penalty. This refactoring avoids that in CollectionProxy#scope.

title: Remove rails.png.
body:
No reason to have a file, we've got data-URIs now! It didn't make sense
to me that you no longer have to remove public/index.html, but you still
need to remove rails.png. This means that you won't have to any more
when making a new Rails app.

Now, a bunch of Railties tests fail because we use the fact that we know that rails.png exists to test them. I wanted to submit this as a PR to get feedback about the idea before I spent the time figuring out how to deal with that.

/cc @dhh

title: each_with_index  => each as we dont use index
body: `each_with_index`  to `each` as we don't use index in test

title: Prefer find_by over dynamic finders in rdoc
body: rdoc only version of https://github.com/robertomiranda/rails/commit/7baecc48028e2d0cb57936ad10b9102ed129c9f9

title: Changed the guides for associations, warning about race conditions when checking for distinctness
body:
I change the rails guides to use ``distinct`` instead of ``uniq`` because that's the new naming convention (see commit https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/a1bb6c8b06db83546179175b9b2dde7912c86f9b). 

I've also provided an example of how distinctness when inserting into an association can be
achieved. I'm making a PR instead of using doc rails because I'm not sure if this is the best place to put this comment, or whether it is better put in some other part of the docs (or maybe if it isn't relevant at all and should be left out).

title: write sql queries to terminal
body: For debugging Active Record issues one has to look at queries which are being generated. This PR writes SQL queries to terminal.

title: no need to invoke to_s before applying intern
optimize some code around merge
body: Optimize some code around `merge`, also drop extra variables while doing so.

title: replace #merge with relation API calls in calculations_test.
body: I was looking at the `#count` implementation trying to resolve some issues. While I did not solve the issues yet I streamlined the calculation_tests to use the Relation API in place of the old hash-syntax using #merge.
